newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen shares close lower on correction.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen shares close lower on correction.

text.p: Shenzhen's A and B share indices closed Wednesday lower on a technical correction after strong rises in the previous session, brokers said.
The B share index dropped 1.88 points or 1.32 percent to end at 140.27 on volume of 18.54 million shares worth HK$96.51 million against Tuesday's HK$136 million.
The A share index slid 3.43 points or 1.03 percent to close at 329.73 on turnover of 3.43 billion yuan compared with 4.59 billion yuan on Tuesday.
Brokers said sentiment remained unstable, with the direction of the market unclear.
"The A and B stock markets are likely to continue to consolidate around current levels," an analyst said.
Institutions are unlikely to engage in large-scale trading unless there is major market-moving news, brokers said.
Television maker Konka was the worst B share performer, losing HK$0.37 or 4.36 percent to HK$8.11 on thin volume of 77,481 shares due to speculative selling, brokers said.
Hotelier Dadonghai followed with a slide of HK$0.11 or 3.06 percent to HK$3.49 on trade of 931,900 shares on profit-taking, brokers said.
Television tube producer SEG edged up HK$0.09 to HK$6.18 on the session's heaviest trade of 3.79 million shares, brokers said.
Building materials producer Fangda, the second biggest B share gainer, put on HK$0.11 or 1.43 percent to HK$7.78 after 482,440 shares changed hands.

On the A share market, Chongqing Real Estate tumbled 0.61 yuan or 4.81 percent to 12.07 yuan due to profit-taking. Beverage packaging materials supplier Zhuhai Zhongfu dipped 0.48 yuan or 3.68 percent to 12.55 yuan.
Profit-taking sent market leader Shenzhen Development Bank down 0.53 yuan to 16.49 yuan after 12.5 million shares changed hands, brokers said.
Port facilities operator Beihai Xinli closed at its 10 percent limit-up of 8.32 yuan on speculative buying, they said.
